Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Tue Jun 13 20:55:14 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

web address.

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large

the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a mystic purple synthcotton shipsuit and a pair of mystic purple
suede clogs. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet
around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her
wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved
with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst
crystals, a light purple flightbag with a pastel kitten on the side, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, an
elegant white gold ring inset with a perfect solitaire diamond, and a soft
fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both eyes,
both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, Purr the humanoid service
robot, and Prissy the big violet long-haired felo here.
You can go south and out.

and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
i
 You are wearing a long-sleeved dark green tee appliqued with small silver
stars, a pair of blue corduroy jeans, and a pair of washed light khaki canvas
sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a
pair of white socks. You are also wearing a keychain, a backpack, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing
a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a leather briefcase, a flight
control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched
metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a thick synthleather bandolier
with large pockets, a camera bag, a black engineering tool case, and a black
flightbag with a red shooting star on the side. Your head, face, both eyes,
neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

ftl old earth
Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Old Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, Old Earth transmits, "Greetings, Firestorm!
Welcome to Old Earth Orbit!"

l jada
Jada Nelson
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has caramel skin. Her body is full-figured with pleasantly rounded hips and
strong calves. She has rounded shoulders and rather large breasts. Her face is
oval and lovely, with a delicate nose and round chin. Her lips are full and
brown and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of
expressive eyebrows, her eyes are brown and almond-shaped. Her mid-back length,
very curly hair is dark chocolate brown with gold streaks and hanging in tiny,
delicate ringlets. She has oval clear fingernails.
 She is wearing a sleeveless amber cotton dress with a row of tiny matching
ribbon rosettes at the neckline and hem and a pair of white flats. She is also
wearing a keychain, a message board reader, a portable newsfeed aggregator, a
violet backpack, a flight control scanner, a primrose yellow touch einrophone in
a brown leather phone holster, a metachannel FTL communicator and watch, a
personal filing computer, a bulky asteroid supply cannon, a purple vinyl duffel
bag, a compact metallic sapphire blue camera with a gold fleur-de-lys embossed
on the front with a glittery blue camera strap, a large expandable telescoping
xenology container, and a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets. Her
head, face, both eyes, neck, both biceps, both elbows, both forearms, both
wrists, both hands, both thighs, both knees, both calves, and both ankles are
left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, Purr the humanoid service
robot, and Mischief the large black felo here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on Shule Elemmire's lap.

Lily Kaise
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a mystic purple synthcotton shipsuit and a pair of mystic purple
suede clogs. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet
around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her
wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved
with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst
crystals, a light purple flightbag with a pastel kitten on the side, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, an
elegant white gold ring inset with a perfect solitaire diamond, and a soft
fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both eyes,
both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on Shule Elemmire's lap.
You can go south and out.

received at League Asteroid Processing Nuclear Temporary Station from the
two-person hardened asteroid hauler "Lordy, The Rocks!". The organization has
earned 597,580.38 credits.

Prissy the big violet long-haired felo wanders in from the north.

forelegs on your leg, then rubs its head against you, purring softly.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a small oval turquoise rattan table with
a glass top, a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard and
filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it, and Prissy the
big violet long-haired felo here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
You can go south and out.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

lizard named Asteria. The lizard's tongue flicks out once, then its head lunges
forward, snapping up the food in a sudden blur and immediately swallowing it
whole.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on Shule Elemmire's lap.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

many tendrils.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

[Starship "RockIt!"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a small lavender trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick gold fringe, a large white and dusky pink paisley floor pillow
with thick silver fringe, a small pink ball containing some crinkly paper, and a
very soft quilted light purple sleeping mat with a large lavender bed pillow, a
large turquoise quilt with an appliqued magenta and white lotus blossom design,
and a large silky sapphire quilt embroidered with purple and pale purple
dragonflies on it here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a very soft quilted light purple sleeping mat.
You can go up and out.
sit mat
Lily Kaise uses the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
You sit down on a very soft quilted light purple sleeping mat with a large
lavender bed pillow, a large turquoise quilt with an appliqued magenta and white
lotus blossom design, and a large silky sapphire quilt embroidered with purple
and pale purple dragonflies on it.

DEEP. YOU WON'T UNDERSTAND THAT YOU HAVE TO WALK RIGHT UP TO THE ONES WHO ARE
BEING HATEFUL AND LAUGH IN THEIR FACES AND EARN THEIR RESPECT. INSTEAD YOU'll
TRY TO FIGURE OUT WHAT YOU DID TO MAKE THEM MAD AT YOU."[0m
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "RockIt!, you have clearance to launch.
Good luck and come back to us safely."
[0m[Miriani] [AIE | Channel 1] Stanton Sefdon transmits, "If for any reason we are
not available at the exact time of departure, Will we be welcome to be dragged
aboard in case we are able to help out further into the night."[0m
tra 1 On our way.
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Shule Elemmire transmits, "On our way."
[0m[Miriani] (Empanda Station; Observation Center) The three-person heliogaster
"Viento Azul" has jumped into the sector.[0m
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
|kR1yd|zV)\ii<a~o<&yYr?-+cQ=+H-3:Ymu4z>*
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, League Solar Weather Station transmits,
"Current riftflow conditions are 2147 light-minutes per second from Galactic
Northnortheast and Slightly Up."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'RockIt!.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."
[0m[Miriani] (Empanda Station; Observation Center) The three-person heliogaster
"Viento Azul" has docked with Empanda Station.[0m
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
Lily Kaise transfers a toll payment to a local rift accelerator.
[Notification from Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] The organization has
received 178,090.92 EAOS credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating
Solar Toll Station in The Belt of Orion.
The computer announces, "Setting course to Asteroid Beacon Alpha 285. Local rift
accelerator with matching vector found."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
A high pitched whistling sound screams overhead as a mortar shell flies through
the air. It explodes nearby with tremendous force, and when the dust and smoke
clears, the starship is gone, replaced with a deep earthen trench and the sounds
of battle.
Lily Kaise speaks into her neon purple metachannel FTL communicator:
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Lily Kaise transmits, "It will take us about
10 minutes to get to 285 initially."
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Vernos Bailey transmits, "Well I am trying to
use that ten minutes wisely."

Message Beacon transmits, "Thank you for travelling all this way for your
asteroid hauling needs. Please enjoy the supply of asteroids while they last.
Beware of pirates, IFS, and other such hostile ships. If at all possible get
ship class information when you report over tactical and land on one of the
stations to be safe. To get home just travel back to Home beacon alpha 286.

remember to power down your ship."

from the barrel to automatically secure itself to a single-use asteroid anchor
with an attached line.

[Starship "RockIt!"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at Comet Surface.
You see a small lavender trash bin, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick gold fringe, a large white and dusky pink paisley floor pillow

anchor
You press the button to deploy the ship's anchor.
A sharp crack is heard throughout the ship as the anchors on either side deploy
with explosive force, biting deep into the surface of the asteroid.
The ship's engines fire, and the anchored asteroid gradually begins to move
toward League Asteroid Processing Nuclear Temporary Station.
The computer reports that the asteroid is approximately three sectors from its
destination.

use cannon
You raise a bulky asteroid supply cannon to your eye and begin carefully aiming
at the asteroid's surface through the scope.
(18 seconds roundtime.)
After a few careful seconds aligning everything in the scope, it flashes the
okay to fire. You pull the trigger and an anchor shoots rapidly from the barrel
of a bulky asteroid supply cannon! You lift off the asteroid's surface slightly,
landing as the anchor finishes securing itself.

ship. Hopefully it will hold.

possesses a hostile environment.

use cannon
You raise a bulky asteroid supply cannon to your eye and begin carefully aiming
at the asteroid's surface through the scope.
(18 seconds roundtime.)
After a few careful seconds aligning everything in the scope, it flashes the
okay to fire. You pull the trigger and an anchor shoots rapidly from the barrel
of a bulky asteroid supply cannon! You lift off the asteroid's surface slightly,
landing as the anchor finishes securing itself.
use cannon
You raise a bulky asteroid supply cannon to your eye and begin carefully aiming
at a single-use asteroid anchor through the scope.
(36 seconds roundtime.)
The scope flashes the okay to fire. You pull the trigger and a ribbon shoots
from the barrel to automatically secure itself to a single-use asteroid anchor
with an attached line.

use cannon
You raise a bulky asteroid supply cannon to your eye and begin carefully aiming
at a single-use asteroid anchor through the scope.
(40 seconds roundtime.)
The scope flashes the okay to fire. You pull the trigger and more ribbon line
shoots out to automatically secure itself to a single-use asteroid anchor with
an attached line. It quickly spools itself up, tensioning tightly over your
ship. Hopefully it will hold.

The computer announces, "Setting course to Home Beacon Alpha 286. Local rift
accelerator with matching vector found."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
Lily Kaise says, "Hmm."
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The starship has left a unique area of space.
The formless mists suddenly resolve into a dust-laden wind. After a moment the
dust settles, and one of the horses in front of you lets out a quiet whicker as
the carriage's wheels creak ceaselessly below.

[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
Even though this starship garage smells like machine oil and heavy lubricants,
it is spacious and well-lit. Massive hydraulic systems raise and lower starships
to and from the landing pad above, and technicians and mechanics in silvery gray
coveralls ensure that everything keeps running smoothly. A well-lit stairway
which leads to the pilot's lounge is here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick
fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a stretchy long-sleeved light blue top with a colorful dragonfly
print, a pair of skinny blue low rise jeans, and a pair of white leather clogs
with a row of glittery fireflies across the toes. She is also wearing an orange
and white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny
tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer,
a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire
and small purple amethyst crystals, a light purple flightbag with a pastel
kitten on the side, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple
reinforced plastic phone holster, an elegant white gold ring inset with a
perfect solitaire diamond, and a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled
'Asteria'. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, both hands, and waist
are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

**
 Welcome back to Star Conquest!
**
 One new post to the changelog since you were last connected. Type CHANGELOG NEW
to read it.

those costs.

A metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator chimes softly as it receives a
new notice.
[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
read comm
You glance at your communicator's screen.
There is one board post.
**
 Welcome back to Star Conquest!
**
 Consider voting for Star Conquest at MUD listing sites! Votes help keep new
players coming to the game!

quest

detail.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a small oval turquoise rattan table with
a glass top, and a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.

get jeans

wear jeans

wear sneakers

close suit

put suit in briefcase

[Starship "William Dove"; Observation Deck]
You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, an antique oak
table from Old Earth, a textured plasteel floor lamp with a cream shade (casting
a white-colored glow), a violet leather sectional sofa, a glossy lilac ceramic
felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling coral pink-lit aquarium containing light
blue and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Cheri-Pye the large light violet
felo, and Prissy the big violet long-haired felo here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.

You see a soft round ocean blue rug with a design of coral and turquoise
seashells, a blueberry rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered
cushion on it, a round white rattan dining table with a glass top, a blueberry
rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered cushion on it, a rattan

lizard named Asteria here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
You can go south and out.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average, naturally
shaped breasts with prominent rosy nipples. Her abdomen is attractive and
punctuated by a cute navel. More intimately, she has soft pale honey blonde
pubic hair and a girlish butt. Her face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose
and understated chin. Her lips are lovely and blush pink and occasionally part
to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are
blue-green and almond-shaped. Her mid-back length, straight hair is pale honey
blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls down her back. She has oval
pink fingernails.
A small enameled crimson dragon pierces her belly button, a small enameled
cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing nothing. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer
bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells
around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring
engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple
amethyst crystals, and an elegant white gold ring inset with a perfect solitaire
diamond. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both shoulders, chest, back, both
biceps, both elbows, abdomen, both forearms, both wrists, both hands, waist,
both hips, groin, both thighs, both knees, both calves, both ankles, and both
feet are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a

enter
Board what?
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl borderlands
The ship is already moving.
ftl borderlands
The ship is already moving.
ftl borderlands
The ship is already moving.
ftl borderlands
ftl borderlands
The ship is already moving.
Once the frontier of Known Space for many years, the Borderlands region is now a
settled area of space, though rather poor compared to most others. A handful of
beacons indicate the positions of clouds of debris, but a nearby star indicates
a solar system may also be in this cluster.
Via general sector communication, Beacon D-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Firestorm.' Welcome to The Borderlands."

#Miriani
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Firestorm!
Welcome to home space!"

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole

sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.

What notice would you like to send to all AEU communicators?
Greetings pilots. The last few days have seen very little space combat activity
in terms of beacon drops and the like. A good number of rats have been
destroyed, but I would like to see more space combat and especially, an increase
in solo fighter combat. Therefore, I am sending out this comm notice to inform
you that starting at midnight on the 17th of this month, I will be holding a
fighter combat contest. During the following eight days, I will keep track of
which fighter has destroyed the most outsider, battle thrall, and allied pirate
ships. At the end of those eight days, the first, second, and third place
winners will receive a cash prize. I will also make a board post about it. Let's
all participate and good luck to those who do.

very little space combat activity in terms of beacon drops and the like. A good

Notice from the Space Defense Captain: Greetings pilots. The last few days have
seen very little space combat activity in terms of beacon drops and the like. A
good number of rats have been destroyed, but I would like to see more space
combat and especially, an increase in solo fighter combat. Therefore, I am

eight days, I will keep track of which fighter has destroyed the most outsider,
battle thrall, and allied pirate ships. At the end of those eight days, the
first, second, and third place winners will receive a cash prize. I will also
make a board post about it. Let's all participate and good luck to those who do.

Enter a subject for your new post.
[General Communication] Alko Delovega transmits, "Hi."
AEU Solo Combat Fighter Challenge
Enter the body of your post.
[Type lines of input; use `.' to end or `@abort' to abort the command.]
Attention AEU pilots,
It's time to improve our space combat skills, especially solo combat in a
fighter. Starting at midnight on July 17, the Space Defense office will be
holding a contest to see how many outsider, battle thrall, IFS, and allied
pirate ships can be destroyed by a single fighter in eight days. The top three
winners will receive a cash prize! Here are the rules!
1. Only outsider, outsider, battle thrall, and allied pirate ships will count
towards the number of ships destroyed.
2. You may only use an AEU, short-term rented, or long-term rented fighter-class
ship. Otherwise, I will not see it on my reports.
3. RATS and bari spreaders do not count.
4. If you plan to participate, but rent a ship from out at Tannhausser Gate or
rent an org ship, please send me via mail the name of the ship you used and the
approximate time you finished your combat so that I may credit destroyed ships
to the correct pilot.
5. Only qualifying ships destroyed during the contest period will count.
When will this contest take place? From midnight on July 17, until 2359 on July
24.
Prizes:
First place: 50 million credits
Second place: 35 million credits
Third place: 20 million credits
If you have questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to get in touch with
me. Good luck!
*

*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
*
[0m[Miriani] [General Communication] Aria Hunter transmits, "Oh, does anyone want
to join us for our last mission?"[0m
Shule Elemmire, Space Defense Captain
*
.
--
Subject: AEU Solo Combat Fighter Challenge
--
Attention AEU pilots,
It's time to improve our space combat skills, especially solo combat in a
fighter. Starting at midnight on July 17, the Space Defense office will be
holding a contest to see how many outsider, battle thrall, IFS, and allied
pirate ships can be destroyed by a single fighter in eight days. The top three
winners will receive a cash prize! Here are the rules!
1. Only outsider, outsider, battle thrall, and allied pirate ships will count
towards the number of ships destroyed.
2. You may only use an AEU, short-term rented, or long-term rented fighter-class
ship. Otherwise, I will not see it on my reports.
3. RATS and bari spreaders do not count.
4. If you plan to participate, but rent a ship from out at Tannhausser Gate or
rent an org ship, please send me via mail the name of the ship you used and the
approximate time you finished your combat so that I may credit destroyed ships
to the correct pilot.
5. Only qualifying ships destroyed during the contest period will count.
When will this contest take place? From midnight on July 17, until 2359 on July
24.
Prizes:
First place: 50 million credits
Second place: 35 million credits
Third place: 20 million credits
If you have questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to get in touch with
me. Good luck!
Shule Elemmire, Space Defense Captain
--
Do you wish to make this post?
[Enter `yes' or `no']

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a small oval turquoise rattan table with
a glass top, and a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair with Prissy the sleeping big
violet long-haired felo on it, a large oval white and black cloth rug, a rare
black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and sapphire star quilt on
it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow

[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, Purr the humanoid service
robot, and Prissy the big violet long-haired felo here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
[Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] Constantine Stone transmits, "Are guided
missile launchers good for fighters?"

Once a waystation between Old Earth and its newly settled colony, the Colonial
Gate station is now largely irrelevant, but still stands guard here as a sort of
watchtower.
The Centauri Colony remains Old Earth's only remaining major extrasolar
possession. The planet does not appear to be particularly teeming with life,
with the color of the land fading from brownish grasses to grey bedrock.

ABILITIES
--
FLARE
   Attracts attention from a group of enemies.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     10                Time To Use: 4 seconds
FLASH
   Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to stop
what they were doing.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     10                Time To Use: 4 seconds
ILLUMINATE
   Allows your squad to hit more vital parts of the enemy, increasing damage.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
RADIATE
   Radiates light over your battlesuit, causing the enemy to misdirect some
damage, effectively increasing armor.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
LASER GUIDANCE
   Augments your squad's accuracy.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 6 seconds
BLIND
   Blinds a single target for a period of time.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
DIRECTED FLARE
   Irritates and provokes a single target.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
DISTRACT
   Decreases the reaction time of a single enemy.
   Module:     Light
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
MINOR REPAIR
   Slightly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REGENERATE
   Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MINOR GROUP REPAIR
   Slightly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PREEMPTIVE REPAIR
   Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MODERATE REPAIR
   Repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SQUAD RESTORATION
   Grants the squad very slow generative repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MODERATE GROUP REPAIR
   Repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     60                Time To Use: 8 seconds
MAJOR REPAIR
   Greatly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MAJOR GROUP REPAIR
   Greatly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     80                Time To Use: 12 seconds
PULSE
   Stuns a single target.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE
   Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REVERB
   Damages a single target over time.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SONIC SLAM
   Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SONIC WAVE
   Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SHAKE OFF
   Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
GROUP PULSE
   Stuns a group of targets.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
CONFUSE
   Decreases the reaction time of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 6 seconds
KNOCKOUT
   Makes a single target unresponsive indefinitely, or until it is hit.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 12 seconds

[Notification from Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] A load of salvage has been
received at League Salvage Processing Nuclear Rest Station from the two-person
medium transport "Words Of Wisdom". The organization has earned 692,763.29
credits.
The starship has entered a unique area of space.
This area of space seems largely clear and empty, but the ship's computer is
detecting hints of tightbeam transmissions no longer in alignment. The
transmissions have the regularity of automated machinespeak.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.

(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on red alert. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, and a small red insulated cooler here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple

stand
You stand up from a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with thick
silver fringe.
green
You lift a small plastic cover and press a green button.
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.

enter

front. You carefully climb inside.
You hear a sudden high-pitched whine all over the ship as the engineer effects
swift repair of all components.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, and a small red insulated cooler here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise sits down on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with
thick silver fringe.
Lily Kaise squeezes you affectionately.
Lily Kaise makes a selection on the AutoVector control board.

silent

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, and a Tardick
lizard named Asteria here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.

front. You carefully climb out.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, an AEU Combat
Universalist, and a League Paladin here.

powered down.

#Miriani
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, and a small red insulated cooler here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise sits down on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with
thick silver fringe.

Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
The computer announces, "Setting course to Artifact Beacon Gamma 002."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The starship has left a unique area of space.
The formless shifting void gradually acquires a regular crest and fall until,
after several moments, you suddenly realize you are on a wide expanse of ocean.
Tall wooden masts creak above you, and white canvas sails snap in the breeze.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: AEU Recharging
Battery-Powered Rest Station.
Lily Kaise begins the docking sequence.

[Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] Lily Kaise transmits, "Constantine, remember
the AEU has a special bonus on AEU combat ships which other alliances do not.
Also, if you have most likely 3 or more lasers per room in a combat ship, you
want the Crystaline lasers but for ships like Mules, transports and the like
where you have 1 or 2 lasers, you want more damage so the Heavy lasers are
pretty well-suited for those."
[Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] Constantine Stone transmits, "Ah, okay."
[Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] Constantine Stone transmits, "I didn't know
if it might be worth using the lasers with 10 or 8% hull bonuses on ships with
6+ turrets."

you wat the fastest lasers with the most damage effect so yes there is a balance
issue but I think you can see where i'm going with this."

everyone uses the crystalline optics one on combat ships?"

for being non-energy dependent. However, the EAOS Torpedo Launcher is pretty
good and it's an ok replacement for minis unless you simply don't have enough
cargo space for ammunition."

you can."

aren't that fast as you know."

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, an AEU Combat

kiss lily
You kiss Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise quickly turns a small wheel on the rift drive control board.
A number flap display rapidly flips around to show a new heading of 180.0, 0.0.
Lily Kaise flips a number of failsafe switches on the rift drive control board,
then pushes a heavy lever forward.
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The viewports are briefly obscured by dark shadows, and you feel the ship
bumping up and down as if hitting atmospheric turbulence. When the shadows pass,
sunlight streams in from outside and you can see the ship is being carried along
a forest floor by a procession of black ants.
Lily Kaise quickly turns a small wheel on the rift drive control board.
The ship jerks slightly as the ant carrying it turns abruptly to avoid marching
over a stone.
A number flap display rapidly flips around to show a new heading of 165.0, 2.0.
Lily Kaise says, "Heh ants."
Lily Kaise laughs.
'The ants go marching one by one.
You say, "The ants go marching one by one."
Lily Kaise quickly turns a small wheel on the rift drive control board.
A number flap display rapidly flips around to show a new heading of 0.0, 0.0.
The ship tilts backward and seems to hang in midair as it is slowly carried over
an overturned tree.
Lily Kaise says, "Wow we missed it again this is screwy."
Lily Kaise turns a small dial on the rift drive control board, trimming the
riftsail to 50%.
The ship tilts backward and seems to hang in midair as it is slowly carried over
an overturned tree.
Lily Kaise quickly turns a small wheel on the rift drive control board.
A number flap display rapidly flips around to show a new heading of 0.0, -1.0.
#Miriani
The starship has entered a unique area of space.
This area of space seems largely clear and empty, but the ship's computer is
detecting hints of tightbeam transmissions no longer in alignment. The
transmissions have the regularity of automated machinespeak.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.

for a moment.

#Miriani
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, and Lily Kaise (League Paladin) here.
You can go up and out.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
Lily Kaise says, "Um."

front. You carefully climb out.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, and Lily Kaise (League
Paladin) here.
You can go up and out.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
