#Miriani
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, and Lily Kaise (League
Paladin) here.
You can go up and out.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise kisses you.
Lily Kaise makes a selection on the AutoVector control board.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on red alert. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You can go up and out.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, Lily Kaise (League
Paladin), and an AEU Combat Universalist here.
You can go up and out.

lit. Miscellaneous supplies are scattered around, often tipped over haphazardly
or spilled across the deck, as though someone left in a great hurry or someone

container which seems largely intact, however.

#Miriani
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, and Lily Kaise (League
Paladin) here.
You can go up and out.
A League Paladin suddenly splits down the front and deposits Lily Kaise.
Lily Kaise says, "Haha so close."
Lily Kaise squeezes you affectionately.
[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, and a League Paladin
here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise laughs.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

lit. Miscellaneous supplies are scattered around, often tipped over haphazardly
or spilled across the deck, as though someone left in a great hurry or someone

container which seems largely intact, however.

lit. Miscellaneous supplies are scattered around, often tipped over haphazardly

else has already looted the place. There is an occasional strange crystalline
container which seems largely intact, however.

[Glyphmaker Artifact; Egress] (inside a battlesuit)
You can go east.
launch

(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, and a League Paladin
here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go up and out.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, a League Paladin, and an
AEU Combat Universalist here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go up and out.

leather briefcase.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, a League Paladin, and an
AEU Combat Universalist here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on Shule Elemmire's lap.
You can go up and out.
(You are sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with thick
silver fringe.)

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, and a compact
purple microwave oven here.
You can go up and out.
Lily Kaise (League Paladin) returns from deep space.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, and Lily Kaise (League Paladin) here.
You can go up and out.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.
[Starship "Seventh Star"; Control Room]
You see a wormhole drive tracer, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a large white and turquoise paisley floor
pillow with thick silver fringe, a small seashell pink trash can, a shiny round
deep sapphire blue table with a painted tablecloth of intertwined sugar maple
trees, a compact white refrigerator, a small red insulated cooler, a compact
purple microwave oven, Lily Kaise (League Paladin), and an AEU Combat
Universalist here.
You can go up and out.
You collect the items you retrieved from the battle and place them into a
leather briefcase.

Lily Kaise sits down on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with
thick silver fringe.
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
The computer announces, "Setting course to Artifact Beacon Gamma 002."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
Lily Kaise cuddles up to you.
[0m02:00:01[0m
The computer beeps in an imperative manner and informs you that the starship's
sensors have detected a new location of interest in the riftflow.
Lily Kaise stands up from a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with
thick silver fringe.
cudle lily
I don't understand that.
Lily Kaise sits down on your lap.
The starship has left a unique area of space.
A fiery cloud of pyroclastic ash roars through the starship, burning the walls
away. When it passes, the ship is a drifting platform hovering through a barren
hellscape covered in ash. A volcano spews ash and fire into the blackened sky as
glowing lava flows down its sides. The scorched remains of trees, animals, and
humans caught in the blast litter the ground.
wrap lily
You wrap your arms around Lily Kaise, pulling her close.
grin lily

[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "We achieved
our first tier performance goal! Good job! Let's go for all of them next time!"
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "Our
performance was up 103.9% from the last Conquest period. Good job!"
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."

occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

[Starship "Seventh Star"; Weapons Room]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. The status lights
overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Starseekers &
Troubleshooters", a luxuriously soft oval deep sapphire blue rug with a gold
fleur-de-lys in the center and thick gold fringe, and a white four poster rattan
bed with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft
periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle
bed pillow, a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The two-person Accord gemini "Seventh Star" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a small trash can, a plastic emergency
bubble, and a sanitation drone here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
The two-person Accord gemini "Seventh Star" is loaded onto an automated flatbed
and slowly moved into a large garage.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
You see an automatic teller machine, a small trash can, a plastic emergency
bubble, and a sanitation drone here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The two-person Accord gemini "Seventh Star" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a small trash can, a plastic emergency
bubble, and a sanitation drone here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
l casper
Kip Casper (asleep)
He appears to be 22 years old. He is about six feet and zero inches tall and has
fair skin. His body is slightly muscled with muscled hips and strong calves. He
has average-sized shoulders and a wide chest. His face is square and somewhat
handsome, with an average nose and dimpled chin. His lips are average and
light-colored and occasionally part to reveal a set of white teeth. Beneath a
set of expressive eyebrows, his eyes are blue-grey and round. His close-cropped,
bristly hair is dark blonde and neatly combed. He also has a short dark blonde
neatly trimmed beard. He has neatly trimmed pale fingernails.
 He is wearing a standard grey shipsuit and a pair of shiny black boots. He is
also wearing a keychain, a message board reader, a portable newsfeed aggregator,
an orange metachannel FTL communicator, and a small cloth sack. His head, face,
both eyes, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
He is carrying nothing.

A sanitation drone diligently piles a plastic emergency bubble onto its
frontward lift, and promptly empties the lift into its compressor.

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
You can go out.

[Teslatown; Finial Avenue] (inside a battlesuit)
Finial Avenue is a length of rather scorched concrete lined by the series of
tall lightning rods that gives it its name. An arching metal lattice overhead
and to either side forms a Faraday cage that keeps out electrical energy.
Scientists and technicians walk up and down the street, wearing environmental
suits which also act as Faraday cages in addition to possessing bulky cooling
units. Among these people occasionally stride even larger figures: people in
powered armor, their suits designed both for environmental protection and
intense ground combat.

over its entirety, by far the largest such construct on the planet. The massive
cage encloses Teleforce Tom's Lounge and Pub as well as the Electrostatic
Exchange.

A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

proceed to AFW Command (Dock One) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
:;H`IJTz)MMc#K'#;*1^FU87Vq1%6m:E%WF(DWzy
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "Striking Distance"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a wormhole drive tracer, and a decoy
beacon launcher here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go up and out.

to launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

green
You lift a small plastic cover and press a green button.
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
move

Welcome to home space!"

 You are wearing a soft Bahama blue cotton polo, a pair of blue corduroy jeans,
and a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are
wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a pair of white socks. You are also
wearing a keychain, a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black
leather phone holster, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold
wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing a metallic silver metachannel FTL
communicator, a leather briefcase, a flight control scanner, a large expandable
telescoping xenology container, a scorched metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo
coin purse, a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, a camera bag, a
black engineering tool case, and a black flightbag with a red shooting star on
the side. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.

[New Earth; Pilot Corps Liaison Office; Space Defense Captain]
This office is small but elegant, the recessed lighting shining softly over pale
green carpet, silvery white walls, and a modestly sized modern steel desk with
an ergonomically designed mesh and leather chair behind it. Arranged in front of
the desk are several other chairs, while ferns in white pots occupy the corners
of the office, and on the walls are framed images of sleek AEU starships. The
door is open.
You see the Space Defense Captain terminal and a large metal filing cabinet
here.
You can go east.
l desk
a brushed steel desk

but stylish and sleek.
On top of it you see a slim black photocopier etched with the AEU symbol, a
bright red einrophone, and a stack of official AEU Space Defense Captain
stationery.

l
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
You can go out.
l couch
I see no "couch" here.

I see no "sofa" here.

sit couch

sapphire star quilt on it.

l white paper
a sheet of white paper [inside a leather briefcase]
This thin sheet of slightly nubby white paper is of standard stationery size.
This is a letter. It is not addressed, and was sent by Lily Kaise. You recognise
the handwriting as belonging to Lily Kaise.
read paper
--
Date November 9, 2316
Hello Kim,
Shule and I are following in the convoy to Andy's which leaves tomorrow at 0200.
At this time, we don't plan to return with Johann and Sean as we want to go to
an artifacting field near Tom Town called Sea of Fears. SEAS has nearly 1500
Exploration so we'll each artifact to add to that balance.
While we're away, as of this date and according to the Range Office, the
Asteroid Processing station in Alpha 285 will go offline in just under 5 days
and the Salvaging Station will go offline in about 9 days. I know we won't be
back before the Asteroid Processing station goes offline and may not have
returned to deploy the replacement Salvaging station.
We'd really appreciate your assistance with deploying the replacement stations.
I have built both stations aboard Herding Cats, my constructor so all that needs
to be done is to fly the constructor out to Alpha 285 and to deploy each station
when needed. I have enclosed a key to Herding Cats for you to use for this
purpose.
Thanks for your assistance and we'll be more than happy to return a similar
favor when needed.
Regards,
Lily Kaise
--
read second paper
--
During the evening of November 13th, 2316, Melinda Michaels arrived
at Famous Andy's Trading Post. We had not been there for a long
time since we drifted off course en route and it required about
another day to get our bearings and to correct our course. When
melinda exited from her Capsule, I felt that she would likely want
to discuss this request from the hyperwave that I was wanted back
in Comms. I further would liked to have had the opportunity to
prepare a written statement as well albeit I didn't ask permission
to do so but I really wasn't given the time to ask very many
questions.
Herein is a transcript of the brief meeting between myself and
Melinda Michaels aboard Johann rowan's Galleon, 'Queen Brynn II'.
I ushered Melinda into the Control Room of the ship and the
exchange began like this. I asked? 'so Melinda do you have a
letter from Nissi?
Melinda Michaels says. "I do not, she is, um, unavailable."
Melinda then says, "So we are running without either voice
currently."
I nodd to Melinda.
I then asked Melinda? 'so who did she appoint to act on her
behalf?
"She did not appoint anybody," Melinda says. "I took it upon myself
to come out here and make sure you guys knew."
I then said to Melinda. 'well first off, I want to thank you for
your efforts in traveling out here.
Melinda next said. "Since she is not available, I will probably
take it upon myself to send whatever letters are needed," Melinda
says. "Somebody has to."
I then went further to state. 'Second, I want to express that i am
very troubled by the news. However, do consider that crime happens
to all citizens of all alliances.
'I am not happy with what has occurred.
Melinda then nodded in agreement.
I then said to Melinda. 'Still, I am not the Military. I am not
the aEU Government. My job is to be a messenger to our Government
Liaison on behalf of AEU pilots and nothing more.
I added with another question? 'So too, did Ather Jammoa send you
here?
"Nobody sent me," says Melinda.
I then said. 'ok well Akemi was acting rather hysterical saying
that I was wanted back there so I'm just trying to understand who
wants me back there.
Melinda, obviously not hearing my question says. "You are the
voice," says Melinda, "troubling times are at hand and here I am."
Melinda says, "We want some kind of word, people are getting
upset."
I responded with. 'yes but if our government felt I should be
there, they have the means to dispatch that request to me. I
informed them before I left of my plans as well.
Melinda asked the following which I hoped would be a good faith
effort on her part to convey my need for clarification. "So," asks
Melinda, "this is what you want me to tell people if they ask?"
She cut me off you see as I wasn't finished with what I had to say
which was. 'Even if i were there, I am not the party who can
control the behavior of aEU citizens.
Melinda says, "Of course you can't."
She continued with. "So, since you weren't asked for in an
official capasity, you will remain on said trip," Melinda says. "Is
this correct?"
I concurred by saying. 'well it's very much out of my hands. They
need to understand that it's not within my power to control AEU
Citizens. It is our government's responsibility to deal with those
issues. You can certainly convey to them in o uncertain terms that
I am not pleased with this behavior but it's also a typical over-
emphasis on the partof the media and related to recent elections no
doubt.
Melinda says, "Okay I will do this."
Melinda says, "All right."
Melinda Michaels then stood up to leave without repeating anything
back to me as well as she didn't let me finish what I was saying.
I just went on by stating. 'If I were back there, there really
isn't anything I could do.
Melinda then says, "I just hope nobody else dies."
She still wasn't allowing me to complete my statement. so I went
on to say. 'AEU pilots themselves haven't communicated anything to
me as well.. "That's fine," says Melinda.
Melinda says, "I tried."
'Thank you for doing so.
Melinda waved. Then she says, o very unceremoniously, Melinda
says, "Yup."
Melinda says, "Later."
I waved back rather amazed that she seemed both not interested in
what I was trying to gather from the scant information I had as
well as nothing official from the leadership from the league nor
Ather Jammoa or from any other AEU pilot back in Comms.
Melinda Michaels then rather rudely walked out. There is certainly more that I
would like to have discussed or to have asked if I could prepare a written
statement or even asked for a brief period of time to consider a request which
didn't come to me in an official capacity. Still, I would have. I took time to
consider Melinda's request albeit it was troubling that noone from the AEU
seemed as concerned as the League were. Since we were traveling with Johann in
his ship, I felt that we should at least finish his business and so we went on
to Tom Town to charge overnight. Our plan was indeed to proceed after the ship
was charge onto Sea of Fears the next day. After a rather sleepless night, when
I noticed that Johann was awake, I proceeded to the Control Room and very
apologetically asked johann if he would be able to forego artifacting at Sea of
Fears. That I felt that I should return to Comms to try to get a better grasp of
the situation there as well as to attempt to do what I could. Johann was very
gracious and he
said that he understood my concerns and that we could return to
Comms. Since there was no other means aboard Johann's Galleon to
communicate that we were returning, it is unfortunate that a hasty
decision was made by the AEU liaison on my behalf. I further find
it regretable that Melinda was in so much of a hurry not to allow
me to prepare a written statement which I couldn't have prepared
before her arrival as I simply had so little to go on. I apologize
to you all though as I did, in good faith, try to assess what the situation was
in the way of this order for me to return to Comms thus compromising the plans
of
others without an official directive. Had Melinda even mentioned that Ather
Jammoa or other AEU pilot expressed that I should have returned I wouldn't have
hesitated even without anything official from the AEU Government Liaison office.
Lily Kaise

read third paper
--
Date November 17, 2316
Dear Mr. Lambeth,
I am providing a statement to you below which concerns my interactions with
Melinda Michaels after she arrived on Famous Andy's Trading Post whereby she
demanded my return to Comms. In addition, i want to share my own perspective and
that I never absolutely refused to return to Comms.
I am very sympathetic to others and especially when the news related such
horrific crimes towards humanity, why, then didn't any of our own pilots support
this? It seems that they only did so when it became apparent that it was a
problem for the AEU and i didn't act immediately on Melinda Michael's request.
Also, i want to point out to you that Kim Saunders who you have just appointed
as Voice of the Corps, yesterday evening, related confidential information which
was posted on our AEU Debate board over the General Channel concerning what I
wrote. Kim Saunders often confides in Melinda Michaels and others from the
League rather than to her own allies. How can we possibly trust someone who is
going to discuss every communication or otherwise which transpires on the AEU
message boards or over the AEU communications channel? Since I'm not able to do
so, I hope your office will, remind AEU pilots of the confidential nature
regarding AEU business and other issues is and how it is to be treated
confidentially and not shared outside of the AEU Pilot Corps. I certainly
thought that this related to what is posted on the message boards within the
AEU, discussions which take place on the aEU communications Channel as well as
during meetings and other exchanges which are specific to the AEU Pilot Corps.
Thank you and please see below.
During the evening of November 13th, 2316, Melinda Michaels arrived at Famous
Andy's Trading Post. We had not been there for a long time since we drifted off
course en route and it required about another day to get our bearings and to
correct our course. When melinda exited from her Capsule, I felt that she would
likely want to discuss this request from the hyperwave that I was wanted back in
Comms. I further would liked to have had the opportunity to prepare a written
statement to send back via Melinda Michaels. However, I didn't get the
opportunity to ask permission to do so. I also really wasn't given time to ask
very many questions. After Melinda Michaels abruptly exited the Galleon, she
went to the Bar and so I also went to the bar. Just as I was about to ask her if
she would consider discussing the situation further with me as well as I also
wanted to prepare something in writing, she bought food and then said her
goodbyes.
Herein is a transcript of the brief meeting between myself and
Melinda Michaels aboard Johann rowan's Galleon, 'Queen Brynn II'.
I ushered Melinda Michaels into the Control Room of the ship and the exchange
proceeded. I asked? "so Melinda do you have a letter from Nissi?" Melinda
Michaels says, "I do not, she is, um, unavailable." Melinda then says, "So we
are running without either voice currently." I nodded to Melinda. I then asked
Melinda? "so who did she appoint to act on her behalf?" "She did not appoint
anybody," Melinda says." "I took it upon myself to come out here and make sure
you guys knew." I then said to Melinda, "well first off, I want to thank you for
your efforts in traveling out here." Melinda next said, "Since she is not
available, I will probably take it upon myself to send whatever letters are
needed". "Somebody has to." I then went further to state. "Second, I want to
express that i am very troubled by the news. However, do consider that crime
happens to all citizens of all alliances. "I am not happy with what has
occurred." Melinda then nodded in agreement. I then said to Melinda. "Still, I
am not the Military. I am not the AEU Government. My job is to be a messenger to
our Government Liaison on behalf of AEU pilots and nothing more." I then asked
another question? "So too, did Ather Jammoa send you here?" "Nobody sent me,"
says Melinda. I then said. "ok well Akemi was acting rather hysterical saying
that I was wanted back in Comms so I'm just trying to understand who wants me
back there." Melinda, obviously not hearing my question says. "You are the
voice, troubling times are at hand and here I am." Melinda says, "We want some
kind of word, people are getting upset." I responded with. "yes but if our
government felt I should be there, they have the means to dispatch that request
to me. I informed them before I left of my plans as well." Melinda asked the
following which I hoped would be a good faith effort on her part to convey my
need for clarification. "So," asks Melinda, "this is what you want me to tell
people if they ask?" She cut me off you see as I wasn't finished with what I had
to say which was. "Even if i were there, I am not the party who can control the
behavior of AEU citizens." Melinda says, "Of course you can't." She continued
with. "So, since you weren't asked for in an official capasity, you will remain
on said trip," Melinda says. "Is this correct?"" I concurred by saying. 'well
it's very much out of my hands. They need to understand that it's not within my
power to control AEU Citizens. It is our government's responsibility to deal
with those issues. You can certainly convey to them in no uncertain terms that I
am not pleased with this behavior but it's also a typical over-emphasis on the
part of the media and related to recent elections no doubt." Melinda says, "Okay
I will do this." Melinda says, "All right." Melinda Michaels then stood up to
leave without repeating anything back to me as well as she didn't let me finish
my response. I continued by stating. "If I were back there, there really isn't
anything I could do." Melinda then says, "I just hope nobody else dies." She
still wasn't allowing me to complete my statement. so I went on to say. "AEU
pilots themselves haven't communicated anything to me as well." "That's fine,"
says Melinda." Melinda says, "I tried." "Thank you for doing so." I said.
Melinda waved. Melinda says, "Yup." Melinda says, "Later." I waved back rather
amazed that she seemed both not interested in what I was trying to gather from
the scant information I had as well as nothing official from the leadership from
the league nor Ather Jammoa or from any other AEU pilot back in Comms. Melinda
Michaels then rather abruptly walked out of the ship. There is certainly more
that I would like to have discussed or to have asked if I could prepare a
written statement or even asked for a brief period of time to consider a request
which didn't come to me in an official capacity. Still, I would have. I took
time to consider Melinda's request albeit it was troubling that noone from the
AEU seemed as concerned as the League were. Since we were traveling with Johann
in his ship, I felt that we should at least finish his business and so we went
on to Tom Town to charge overnight and Johann obtained an upgrade for his
Galleon. Our plan was indeed to proceed after the ship was charge onto Sea of
Fears the next day. I still tried to understand why I hadn't heard anything from
the AEU. There were too many unanswered questions. After a rather sleepless
night, when I noticed that Johann was awake, I proceeded to the Control Room and
very apologetically asked johann if he would be able to forego artifacting at
Sea of Fears. That I felt that I should return to Comms to try to get a better
grasp of the situation there as well as to attempt to do what I could. Johann
was very gracious and he said that he understood my concerns and that we could
return to Comms. There was also no other means aboard Johann's Galleon in the
way of a Quantum Entanglement Device to communicate that we were returning. It
is unfortunate that a hasty decision was made by the AEU liaison on my behalf as
I had every intention to do my job. I just felt that the League were controlling
things without the AEU's involvement. I further find it regretable that Melinda
was in so much of a hurry not to allow me to prepare a written statement which I
couldn't have prepared before her arrival as I simply had so little to go on.
I apologize to you, as I did, in good faith, try to assess what the situation
was in the way of this order for me to return to Comms thus compromising the
plans of others without an official directive. Had Melinda even mentioned that
Ather Jammoa or other AEU pilot expressed that I should have returned I wouldn't
have hesitated even without anything official from the AEU Government Liaison
office.
As you can see, I never directly said that I wouldn't return. I didn't say a lot
to Johann Rowan because if his being a member of the League, there were certain
aspects which I didn't consider that he should be privy to. From my own personal
perspective. I'm not insensitive to other individuals from other alliances but
it seemed rather odd that the League were so intent on me when their own
leadership isn't performing. I so wish that Ather Jammoa would have at least
sent a statement or a request via the Hyperwave which we tried to monitor during
the times they can be typically used to transmit from the Torus. I was also not
aboard my own ship and didnt feel that i had total control over another pilot's
vessel. Johann Rowan was, however very gracious and did openly indicate that it
was my judgement call to return or not. Therefore, he is not to blame for the
delay.
I want to state that I deplore any and all acts of intimmidation, violance,
destruction of property or otherwise harm that has been inflicted upon any
individual, regardless of which Alliance, clan or where they are from. If those
acts which i have read about in the news are verifiable as a true representation
of fact, I urge the AEU to take immediate actions to seekout, prosecute and
punish those involved. No matter what has been expressed of others, I do not
hate nor wish any harm to be directed towards any human being from any part of
this universe. The AEU must absolutely uphold a zero tolerance to crimes against
humanity or any living being for that matter.
Lily Kaise

Date 12-21-2316, Time - 2012PM
Hi Love, I'm writing this because I may forget to ask? The current Salvage
processor in 777 will go offline around 2245 on 12-25-2316. Unfortunately, I
won't be available from around 2000 on this date until approximately 0200 on
12-26-2316. Will most likely have the station ready to deploy from Herding Cats
though. If you're available and can deploy the replacement in Asteroid Alpha 285
around the time the current one goes offline, it would be a tremendous help.
Otherwise, I'm sure that it won't cause much of an inconvenience to others if
the new Salvage processor is delayed for a few hours. Thanks for anything you
can do to assist. Love you, - Lily

I have just put up the new Starseekers scooping station. I am sorry that this
was a bit later than you may have expected, but you will be happy to know that
SEAS is in on it now. Please let me or Morris know whether you are happy with
the megacredit income it gives you.
It will be up for 16 days regardless, and we can then see whether having you on
the station is benificial to both of our orgs or not, so, please let us know how
it goes.
Take care,
Kim

read sixth paper

Greetings Melinda,
I discussed the Org rotation idea with Shule for the Grade 80 Debris Field. My
concern was that during the week, I am only available for a few hours during the
early morning from about midnight until around 0300. Then on Weekends, I am
generally available some of the time. Shule won't be working much, if at all,
during the first week in June. So we wouldn't want our rotation to occur during
that particular week. Otherwise, I feel confident that I have Shule's commitment
to back me up if our rotation turn occurs on a weekday or that the beacon chain
needs replacement when I am not able to work.
So, ccount on SEAS to commit to a rotation slot to help to maintain the Grade 80
Beacon Chain.
With kind regards,
Lily Kaise

read seventh paper
--
Kim,
Below is a copy of the letter I have just sent off to Sir Wellington concerning
this Allied Pirate issue.
During the course of the salvage op event that many pilots partook in, there was
an understanding. Mutuality pilot Pierre Louis as well as AEU pilot Eli Gray
brought us some information. We were told that the Allied Pirates would steer
clear of the area seeing as Mutuality friends were in the area.
Due to the large number of IFS and Outsiders in the area, Mister Kelsey says
that he had a group out there ready to defend. The incident that I recall is the
following: Myself, Morris Corlew and Nicolette Lawrence were salvaging. Jason
Rat, Bryan Stout, Emily Ford, Damien Goss and Shule Elemmire were aboard the
gunship. I believe it was my gunship, "The Storm Petrel." The issue is that
Mister Kelsey believes a cease fire was broken when the gunship fired upon his
area defenders. I was waiting in the neighboring sector with the op can so have
no idea who fired first or anything of that nature. I do believe that this was
the op in which they had to switch ships to, a pincer called, "The Wolves have
Claws," so that AEU pilot Kim Saunders could be added to the defense. I also
believe that most of the pilots thought the pirates would not be getting
involved in ops but did not realize they wouldn't be causing issues otherwise.
At any rate, I am inquiring as to whether or not we can find out who fired first
on behalf of the Mutuality pilots. I plan to ask the pilots aboard the ship
about this incident as well.
The other incident that I recall was during the early morning hours, I saw a
couple of pirates come into the sector. I did launch my corvette and they
promptly vacated the sector. I did not fire and was not fired upon.
Melinda Michaels

close briefcase
You close a leather briefcase.
read paper
--
Glyphmaker colors
green is blue and yellow Cancel with red
orange is red and yellow cancel with Blue
violet is red and blue cancel with Yellow
indigo is violet and blue cancelled by saffron
fuchsia is violet and red cancelled by chartreuse
ochre is violet and yellow
vermillion is orange and red cancelled by teal
saffron is orange and yellow cancelled by indigo
taupe is orange and blue
chartreuse is green and yellow cancelled by fuchsia
teal is green and blue cancelled by vermillion
sienna is green and red
blue cancel with Orange
Yellow cancel with Violet
If the glyph at the door flashes black, we cancel it. If white, we match it. So
if we get a red one, it'll flash black, flash a blue and a yellow. If we get an
indigo that flashes white, we first make a violet glyph, then a blue one. If
that indigo flashes black, we cancel it by making a saffron glyph (make an
orange glyph, then add yellow).
--

Blueprint for a Repair Robot
"Required supplies hoverbot chassis 1, small self-sustaining
power source 1, robot controller 1, articulated robotic hand 8, metal
arm 8, electromagnetic nozzle 1, and RATS quicksynth 32"
Blueprint for a hoverbot chassis
Required supplies - metal sphere 1, robotic eye 3, and antigravity
emitter 3
Blueprint for a robotic eye
Required supplies - tiny plastic chassis 1, miniaturized computer chip
2, and optical lens 1
Blueprint for an antigravity emitter
Required supplies - tiny plastic chassis 1, miniaturized computer chip
3, and enclosed negmatter sphere 1
Blueprint for a small self-sustaining power source
Required supplies - medium metal chassis 1, wiring 8, large battery 2,
circuit board 6, and glyph energy source 4
Blueprint for a robot controller
Required supplies - wiring 16, circuit board 32, and miniaturized
computer chip 40
Blueprint for a metal arm
Required supplies - metal ingot 32 and instamold plastic brick 6
Blueprint for an instamold plastic brick
Required supplies - plastic bead: 16 and superacid mixture 1
Blueprint for a superacid mixture
Required supplies - hydraulic fluid ampoule 4
Blueprint for an electromagnetic nozzle
Required supplies - long metal tube 1 and superconducting webbing 1

again. Boasting an impressive 38 hours of charge, this vessel shows that we do
not and should not have to rely on the good will of the other alliances to match

read seventh paper
--
Note - there may be some mistakes in spelling, etc here but I found these notes
concerning Ifs.
Target priority for IFS beacons or invasions
For IFS, you basically want to take out the heavy hitters first.
Almost all of them are able to constantly hit you, and the quicker
you can reduce the rate of damage you're taking the better off
you will be
1. Hades. These just fire constantly and do a lot of damage.
2. Poseidons. Not as bad as Hades, but pretty bad.
3. Artemises. Basic long range attackers, they'll hit you
steadily but not very quickly.
4. Ares. Like Artemises but they can't take a hit.
5. Apollos. No long range attacks. Save them for last.
a few special notes --
Hestia - If you see one of these and you're not in a cruiser...
you should probably leave it to someone who is. They hit very
very hard and they can launch fighters.
Chronos - A very dangerous IFS flagship. Avoid unless you're a
very good pilot. Very good pilot is an understatement these are wicked to deal
with and you will likely lose.
Deployment Apollos - These are about to drop a forward assault station.
But you have some time to take them out before they do. If you see
one of these jump in and you're nearby, drop your current target and
go after it.
This may be the Ifs that looks like a carrier.
Researchers weren't noted but I am pretty sure they would be targeted after the
Poseidons and Ares are destroyed. I'm pretty sure you will see Researchers
mostly on a Beacon or you will see an Ares and a Researcher show up sometimes. I
need to ask Ather.
Interdiction does occur and I thought it was the carrier class but when that
Chronos jumped in on Blake's beacon that time we were interdicted. I was too
busy to check all of the ships and since I was engineering, I couldn't access
other details.
--
read seventh paper
--
Note - there may be some mistakes in spelling, etc here but I found these notes
concerning Ifs.
Target priority for IFS beacons or invasions
For IFS, you basically want to take out the heavy hitters first.
Almost all of them are able to constantly hit you, and the quicker
you can reduce the rate of damage you're taking the better off
you will be
1. Hades. These just fire constantly and do a lot of damage.
2. Poseidons. Not as bad as Hades, but pretty bad.
3. Artemises. Basic long range attackers, they'll hit you
steadily but not very quickly.
4. Ares. Like Artemises but they can't take a hit.
5. Apollos. No long range attacks. Save them for last.
a few special notes --
Hestia - If you see one of these and you're not in a cruiser...
you should probably leave it to someone who is. They hit very
very hard and they can launch fighters.
Chronos - A very dangerous IFS flagship. Avoid unless you're a
very good pilot. Very good pilot is an understatement these are wicked to deal
with and you will likely lose.
Deployment Apollos - These are about to drop a forward assault station.
But you have some time to take them out before they do. If you see
one of these jump in and you're nearby, drop your current target and

This may be the Ifs that looks like a carrier.

Shule, Just in case I fall asleep and am not awake by the time we're supposed to
leave, please can you do the following? If you don't see the aquariums still
sitting around in William Dove, put them all on a hoverpallet and take them with
you? Also, the little pink bed is on a hoverpallet in the airlock of William
Dove, please put it on your hoverpallet and take it with you? Also, all five pet
felo are still in william Dove. Please ask Nissi if it's ok to put them aboard
her Imperator as I do have food bowls for them and please keep those two bags of
chow which I asked you to buy for them. I hope I will have managed to get the
food together. If not, we'll have some day old pizzas and things and there is a
vending machine which has food aboard the Imperator which is the same as the
Galleon so we won't starve! I'll have Asteria with me. There's just a situation
which may cause me to have to sleep unexpectedly. If I'm awake, I'll have taken
care of all of these things. I just want to be sure that the fish aquariums
which comprise yours and mine are taken along with us. If Nissi doesn't want the
pets aboard, they will be fine in William dove for probably a few weeks as
there's 15 bowls for 5 felo so even if Purr isn't around to mind the bowls, they
will be fine. Also, Kim can put her pets in with mine in William dove if Nissi
says no pets. I will still need to get with you to put the two robots aboard
your ships. Again, hopefully I'll have taken care of everything. Just being
precautionary. Hugs! - Lily

read ninth paper
--
Shule,
I know Tatiana Krupin will seek you out now after our last two exchanges. I am
copying in my final post to her below. Although I won't go out of my way to
approach her, one aspect that she needs to accept is that she is not permitted
to silence our outrage. If she can speak out, so should we be able to. I also
wasn't harrassing her but applying peer pressure but it's without a doubt that
she is beyond reason. I know too that you must be careful in your own approach
with Krupin but as a peer, I can certainly express what I want and I have. If I
were in your position, for professional reasons, I certainly would have to
phrase differently. If you do ask her to resign it should likely be moreso that
you remind her of our positions as holding a leadership role and how her own
conduct is also scrutinized by other alliances and that our respective behavior
can and will affect diplomatic relations. Of course this is up to you and you
know exactly how to word it. If I wer her though, I'd much prefer to resign than
to have the whole of AEU civilian pilots voting against me. This obviously
doesn't phase her though. It's very surreal that reality simply does not
register with this woman.
This is my very last post to Krupin -
Tatiana Krupin, I daresay that you have far more to deal with concerning your
own reputation and behavior than I ever will. The reason why I disliked you
early on was for behavior and arrogance exactly like what you just exonerated
through your recent actions. I am a reasonable person and if, for a moment, I
felt that your case was valid, I would be supportive and this would be
regardless of my own opinion of you. i believe in justice and your attempts to
effect unfounded injustice towards our own who have endured far more than you
could ever imagine, worked hardest for us, discovered wonders and are the very
core of our Core vallue. You are truly a poor excuse for a human being and for
your dishonorable abuse. You will indeed pay for your offenses against civilian
pilots. I promise to be there to cheer on the judges. I shall speak to you
whenever I so desire as well. You cannot silence me nor can anyone. I'll likely
not waste my time with writing to you further however as you are beyond
worthwhile of my time and effort.
--
read tenth paper
--
Hello Takana and shule, I am concerned about how you both were treated by Joel
Kringle today. If this was a practical joke, it's ok and I hope both of you are
the better for it. If it wasn't, then please take any concerns such as these to
our Voice of the Corps, Annie Lynn. While she can't force other pilots to treat
you fairly, at least she is there to talk to and through her leadership,
encouraging some level of fair treatment amongst pilots would be in order. Pilot
life isn't the easiest. There will always be those who will are rude and treat
more vulnerable pilots unreasonably. For you both, please don't let your guard
down ever and be careful concerning what you say to other pilots, particularly
to those who are not in our alliance and what you ask of them. Hang in there! -
Lily Kaise

read twentieth paper
--
Starseekers expedition Information
 
Hello,
I write this letter to you to confirm that you are on the crew list of the
expedition I am organizing. this letter also contains some information about the
trip.
 
- we wil be traveling aboard Akemi's science vessel, which she kindly has made
available for this occasion. akemi will hand out keys just before departure. we
will bring a few other ships along, keys for these will be handed out if and as
needed.
- We will start gathering for departure on the first of June at 23:00 GST. we
wil meet on Old Earth in the coffee shop. this coffee shop is located in the
spaceport, between the landing pad and the south point exit. We are aiming for a
departure time of 23:59 GST.
- You should be prepared for a trip that will take roughly 2 weeks. Melinda has
made various food and drink dispensers available, but it might be nice if you
brought a small amount of food for greater variety.
- to keep it fair for everyone, and to make sure we can bring a full crew,
everyone is allowed to bring only 1 pet felo. If you choose to bring one, you
are also required to bring a felo spacesuit for it.
- we will have a few crew members who have never been on an expedition like
this. If you do not have any rift drive repair tools yet, do not worry. akemi
has spare tools available and we will still have time to craft more of such
tools.
- As of the time of this writing, the crew for this expedition is as follows:
Akemi, anfisa, Melinda, Lillian, shule, Lily, Nissi, Liam, Michael, Blake,
simon, Nathaniel, Morris, Sakura, Zandria and myself. 
 
should you have any questions that I have not answered in this letter, feel free
to contact me and ask. also if you are not sure you are still awake during the
gathering and departure time, talk to me or Akemi and we will make arrangements
with you.
I am sure we are all looking forward to a fun expedition, and see you tomorrow!
take care,
Kim (Starseekers founder)
--

read last paper

Date -- 1/4/2317
Liam,
This is one more attempt to provide an accomodation for your organization on
organization sponsored temporary space stations.
I have room for an Ejecter on a Salvage processing and an Asteroid processing
station. The Salvage processing station is currently located in Asteroid Alpha
285 and alternates with Artifact Alpha 777. The Asteroid processor is located in
Asteroid Alpha 285 and provides fairly consistent Megacredits and an occasional
Command point as well as reasonable cash flow. The Salvage processing station
will expire early Saturday morning or 1/7. The replacement will be placed in
Artifact Alpha 777 which has grade 20 to 40 Shipwrecks. This obviously isn't
extremely high grade debris but pilots do find there is a consistent occurance
of grade 40. Still, alternating the salvage processor is an experiment to
determine which of the two areas pilots prefer for obtaining salvage. Therefore,
for the time being, we plan to alternate placing the salvage processor between
Artifact Alpha 777 and Asteroid Alpha 285.
I am enclosing a key to my Module Transport, Building Capital. We use the least
expensive Ejecter which is the Unmanned Pickup. These cost one Megacredit or 5
million EAOS credits. If you would like to participate, please place 2 to 4 of
an Unmanned Pickup ejecter module aboard Building Capital and we will accomodate
Eternal Freedom. At this time, I don't have another organization who is seeking
a slot on these stations and if I don't obtain parts from Eternal Freedom, then
one organization will have to double up on providing parts which works but
unnecessary duplication.
Best regards,
Lily Kaise

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
put filing in briefcase
You open a leather briefcase for a moment.
You put a black laminate filing cabinet in a leather briefcase.
out
You scramble to your feet.
[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, an
early warning space defense device, a glossy sky blue ceramic felo chow bowl,
and KitCat the humanoid service robot here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
out
You exit the ship.

You can go up.

wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, Purr the humanoid service
robot, and Prissy the big violet long-haired felo here.
Lily Kaise is sleeping on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a high tech silver star print holovid, and a Tardick lizard named
Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[Ventilation Tunnels; Entry Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This appears to be an access point to a space station's large ventilation
system. Though, saying that, it doesn't appear quite large enough for a
battlesuit, and the presence of the heavy powered armor appears to be distending
the metal somewhat. But anything is better than a ventilation system filled with
giant bugs and mold!

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.

one can go that other way. The possibilities are endless!

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see Lily Kaise (League Paladin), Constantine Stone (EAOS Plasma Specialist),
and Hakeem Oiadip (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour) here.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see the corpse of Bari Worker Horde Alpha, Lily Kaise (League Paladin),
Constantine Stone (EAOS Plasma Specialist), Hakeem Oiadip (AISSF Rental Advanced
Combat Armour), and Ali Candan (EAOS Elementalist) here.
You can go south and west.
Hakeem Oiadip (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour) prepares to use
Microrestoration!
Hakeem Oiadip (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour) releases a small group of
microdrones.
   Lily Kaise (League Paladin) is rapidly repaired by a swarm of microdrones!
Hakeem Oiadip asks, "Wave?"
Lily Kaise smiles.
peer s

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see Lily Kaise (League Paladin), Hakeem Oiadip (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat

Specialist) here.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You can go north and west.
Lily Kaise exclaims, "That was much better!"

[Ventilation Tunnels; Four-Way Junction] (inside a battlesuit)

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see the corpse of Bari Mold Alpha, Lily Kaise (League Paladin), Hakeem
Oiadip (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour), Ali Candan (EAOS Elementalist),
and Constantine Stone (EAOS Plasma Specialist) here.
You can go north and west.
Lily Kaise whistles.
Hakeem Oiadip (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour) releases a small cloud of
microdrones.
   You, Lily Kaise (League Paladin), Ali Candan (EAOS Elementalist), Constantine
Stone (EAOS Plasma Specialist), and Hakeem Oiadip (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat
Armour) are rapidly repaired by a swarm of microdrones!
      Hakeem Oiadip (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour) repairs 16 of your
damage!
